content.question: For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate. <math alttext="C H 4 gas"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> gas reacts with <math alttext="F 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> to produce <math alttext="C H 3 F gas"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H F gas"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext><mtext>F</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) A particulate representation of <math alttext="F 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above its formula in the equation below. Using the key provided, draw particulate representations of <math alttext="C H 4 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and the two product molecules of the reaction above their formulas in the equation.

frqParts.text: For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate. <math alttext="C H 4 gas"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> gas reacts with <math alttext="F 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> to produce <math alttext="C H 3 F gas"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H F gas"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext><mtext>F</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) A particulate representation of <math alttext="F 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above its formula in the equation below. Using the key provided, draw particulate representations of <math alttext="C H 4 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and the two product molecules of the reaction above their formulas in the equation.

(b) Use the bond enthalpies in the table below to calculate a numerical estimate of <math alttext="delta H"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction. Bond Bond Enthalpy <math alttext="kilojoules per mole"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>kJ/mol)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="C H bond"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 413 <math alttext="C F bond"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 485 <math alttext="H F bond"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 567 <math alttext="F F bond"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>F</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 155

(c) The energy of the reactants is shown on the following energy diagram. On the right side of the energy diagram, draw a horizontal line segment to indicate the energy of the products. Draw a vertical double-headed arrow ( <math alttext="symbol of a vertical double headed arrow"><mstyle><mrow><mo>↕</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ) on the graph that corresponds to the value of <math alttext="delta H"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction.

skill.text: 3.A: Represent chemical phenomena using appropriate graphing techniques, including correct scale and units.
